alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 12 at 3:08AM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN SMITH AND CHEROKEE COUNTIES THROUGH 400 AM CST... At 308 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles southwest of Tyler to 15 miles west of Latexo. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Jacksonville, Whitehouse, Rusk, Bullard, Troup, Berryville, Arp, Mount Selman, Ponta, Mixon, Reese, Maydelle, Lake Palestine, New Summerfield, Noonday, Gallatin, Cuney, Teaselville, and Concord. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CST for northeastern Texas.
